alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 4:47PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT CENTRAL CONVERSE COUNTY... At 446 PM MST...A snow squall was along a line extending from 7 miles east of Deer Creek to 9 miles south of Beartrap Meadows County Park...and moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 25 mph and visibilities less than one mile. SOURCE...Radar and Webcams. IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions due to slick roads and low visibilities. Locations impacted include... Glenrock, Rolling Hills, Rolling Hills Estates, Bill and Deer Creek. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 148 and 174. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Expect rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Motorists are urged to use extreme caution if traveling through these areas! Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. Travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range
